oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Racial Unrest in Arkansas chart
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Chart of organizations and people suspected of contributing to integration efforts in Arkansas. The chart includes organizations such as the NAACP, Fund for the Republic, Southern Regional Council, Southern Conference Educational Fund, Inc., Southern Conference for Human Welfare, and Arkansas Council on Human Relations. Individuals listed include Thurgood Marshall, Daisy Bates, Henry Wallace, L. C. Bates, Vernon McDaniel, Charles Gomillion, Aubrey Williams, Abner W. Berry, Martin Luther King, Claude C. Williams, Clarence Laws, and Stephen Spottswood.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:source: RG 114: 81st General Assembly Special Investigating Committee Highlander Folk School, 1961
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Highlander Folk School (Monteagle, Tenn.); National Association for the Advancement of Colored People; Fund for the Republic; Southern Regional Council; Southern Conference Educational Fund; Southern Conference for Human Welfare; Marshall, Thurgood, 1908-1993; Bates, Daisy; McDaniel, Vernon; Gomillion, Charles G. (Charles Goode), 1900-1995; Williams, Aubrey Willis, 1890-1965; Williams, Claude Clossey, 1895-1979; King, Martin Luther, Jr., 1929-1968; Spottswood, Stephen G. (Stephen Gill), 1897-1974
